text: Trachylepis wahlbergii, also known as Wahlberg's striped skink, is a species of skink endemic to Southern Africa. Whether it is truly distinct from Trachylepis striata is not fully settled. ==Distribution== Trachylepis wahlbergii occurs in southern Angola, northern Namibia, northern Botswana, Zambia, northern and western Zimbabwe, and western Mozambique. ==Etymology== The specific name, wahlbergi, is in honour of Swedish Naturalist Johan August Wahlberg.Beolens, Bo; Watkins, Michael; Grayson, Michael (2011). The Eponym Dictionary of Reptiles. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press. xiii + 296 pp. . (Trachylepis wahlbergii, p. 278). ==References== Category:Trachylepis Category:Skinks of Africa Category:Reptiles of Angola Category:Reptiles of Botswana Category:Reptiles of Namibia Category:Reptiles of Mozambique Category:Reptiles of Zambia Category:Reptiles of Zimbabwe Category:Reptiles described in 1870 Category:Taxa named by Wilhelm Peters
title: Trachylepis wahlbergii
